articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Thousands of Iranians turned out to mourn President Ebrahim Raisi in the city of Tabriz on Tuesday, after he was killed in a helicopter crash near the Azerbaijan border at the weekend along with his foreign minister and seven others.
articles.title: Iranian President Raisi's memorial muted amid public discontent

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Singapore Airlines flight from London made an emergency landing in Bangkok on Tuesday due to severe turbulence, the airline said, with one passengers on board dead and injuries reported.
articles.title: Singapore Airlines flight makes emergency landing in Bangkok, one dead, 30 injuries reported

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces thrust deeper into the Jabalia camp in northern Gaza on Tuesday, laying waste to residential districts with tank and air bombardments, residents said, while Israeli air strikes killed at least five people in the southern city of Rafah.
articles.title: Israeli troops push into Jabalia, airstrikes kill five in Rafah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Tuesday it was very curious that the United States appeared ready to use sanctions against the International Criminal Court whose prosecutor requested arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, his defence chief and three Hamas leaders over alleged war crimes.
articles.title: Kremlin says it is very curious that U.S. appears ready to sanction the ICC

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken is due to make his case for President Joe Biden's $64 billion foreign affairs budget request in four congressional hearings this week, amid deep divides with Republicans over spending priorities and Israel policy.
articles.title: Blinken to testify to US Congress under shadow of Israel policy divides

articles.author: Liz Lee
articles.description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi called Taiwan's newly-inaugurated President Lai Ching-te "disgraceful" on Tuesday, stepping up Beijing's rhetoric just a day after he took office.
articles.title: China's foreign minister calls Taiwan's new president 'disgraceful'
China sanctions ex-US lawmaker and supporter of Taiwan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico underwent a follow-up abdominal CT scan and remains conscious and communicative, doctors treating him said on Tuesday, as he recovers from being hit by four bullets in an assassination attempt last week.
articles.title: Slovak PM Fico has CT scan during recovery from assassination attempt

articles.author: Kirsty Needham, Lucy Craymer
articles.description: Australia and New Zealand said they will send government planes to New Caledonia on Tuesday to evacuate nationals from the French territory which has experienced a week of deadly riots, sparked by electoral changes by the French government in Paris.
articles.title: Australia, New Zealand send evacuation flights to New Caledonia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: EU countries have formally adopted a plan to use windfall profits from Russian central bank assets frozen in the EU for Ukraine's defence, the Belgian government said on Tuesday.
articles.title: EU countries adopt plan to use frozen Russian assets for Ukraine's defence
